result.execSummary:
The defendant Davine Michaela Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:37 AM Defendant Davine Michaela Wade in court with attorney Joseph M. Schieffer.  Defendant Davine Michaela Wade in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls the cases  15CM460, 16CM47, 17CF369 and 19CF372.      Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.   State recites agreement.   All parties agree.    DEF enters NC plea to Count 1.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court accepts plea and finds DEF quilty to Count 1.   Count 2 dismiss and read in.     State makes final statement before sentencing.   Attny Schieffer makes final statement before sentencing.   DEF no comment to court.   Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.    Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  51 days county jail.   51 days jail credit - Time Served.     Fine/Costs  $579.00    DE must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge.     Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Scheduling conference on March 10, 2020 at 10:00 am.

10:47 AM Defendant Davine Michaela Wade in court with attorney Joseph M. Schieffer.  Defendant Davine Michaela Wade in custody by video from Sawyer Co jail.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE attny addressed court on Bond.  DE is currently on a $2500.00 cash combined bond in all 4 of DE's cases (15CM460, 16CM47, 17CF369 & 19CF372).  State argues.  Court denies motion to modify bond. 19CF372 set for Arraignment, all other cases to track along.  BOND CONTINUES.

CBS $2500  COMBINED BOND  19CF372, 17CF369, 15CM460, and 16CM47.      ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages. No drug use and may not possess any controlled substance  without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to the Sawyer County Addiction Intervention Program (S-CAIP) Diane McNamer at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI 54843.   Phone:  715-638-3425  for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options. Testing requirements may be modified during any period the defendant is engaged in community based programming, including but not limited to AODA and/or mental health treatment.     Defendant has been ordered to sign bail bond by 4:00 PM today. Failure to comply with this order will result in a warrant being issued for your arrest.
